text: Arcangelo Corelli (17 February 1653 8 January 1713) was an Italian violinist and composer. He composed some of the most important Italian music of the Baroque period. He was also very famous as a violin player. Other violinists learned from his style of playing and developed the art of playing the violin. His works include sonatas and concerti grossi. Category:18th-century Italian composers Category:Baroque composers Category:Italian violinists Category:1653 births Category:1713 deaths Category:17th-century Italian composers
title: Arcangelo Corelli
